verses.roman:
darśana-ānande prabhu saba pāsarilā
bhakta-gaṇa madhyāhna karite prabhure lañā gelā

synonyms: darśana-ānande—because of pleasure due to seeing the face of the Lord; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; saba—everything; pāsarilā-forgot; bhakta-gaṇa—the devotees; madhyāhna—noontime lunch; karite—to accept; prabhure—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; lañā gelā—took.
translation: Feeling such great pleasure upon seeing the face of Lord Jagannātha, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu forgot everything. The devotees, however, took Him to His lunch at noontime.
